page.title: 07THE BIBLINS
page.content: {The Biblins}is one of the most popular locations near the{River Wye}and has many attractions. One of these is the{Adventure {Centre}owned by the{Forestry {Commission}and rented to school and youth groups. The centre has a kitchen, main hall and 2 dormitories holding 30 people with other rooms for group leaders. The river bank outside is used as a{campsite}for large groups. The{suspension footbridge}across the{River Wye}leads directly into the forest with many footpaths leading from it. The area is very popular for picnics and swimming. The{limestone caves}near the Biblins were used as{iron ore}mines during the 18th.C. ond supplied the dissused foundry on the west bank of the river at 559156.
